channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023120247
item.description:
Report X-2023120247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered after it was brought back to the station (after 1st delivery attempt). The box was torn/ripped. Inner contents were a white plastic pail of Pool Woow, 3" Chlorine Tablets (110 Tablets). No release. Outer packaging is non specification. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023111258
item.description:
Report X-2023111258

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to the damage area for further investigation. Upon inspection the outer cardboard box looked to be soiled on one corner. Two of the caps loosen during transit which caused about 3-4 ounces of liquid to leak out. DescribePack: Cap locked failed which caused about 4 ounces of liquids to leak out. DurationRel: 48 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a hazmat tote for trainer personnel for inspection.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought back to terminal due to being wet. DescribePack: small crack on top of container causing small amount of liquid to leak out of container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was then placed in hazmat bag and tote.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: unloader notice there was a leakage coming from the package DescribePack: package was leaking from loose lid DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put package into a hazmat bag and then into a hazmat drum and started the prosses.

item.title: Report X-2023111173
item.description:
Report X-2023111173

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I was checking the unload for any packages that needed to receive some tape to go out. I had found this damaged Hazmat in the unload, I had received no call about the Hazmat. I had noticed that it was mostly the box was undamaged. While any of the surrounding packages were undamaged DescribePack: The Plastic Bottles cap came loose and leaked its contents DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Keep the package from being crushed

item.title: Report X-2023110854
item.description:
Report X-2023110854

  • City: GOODYEAR

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The Hazmat went up the belt and was crushed from a ic package DescribePack: the plastic jug was dented and leaked its contents DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: STOP sending HazMat's up the belt

item.title: Report X-2023110853
item.description:
Report X-2023110853

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded and on its way to another trailer when it was tipped over. Once leak was discovered, the package was placed in a lined tote and moved to the designated area for damaged hazardous material packages. DescribePack: Cap to bottle was not tighten close. Small stain left on outside packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bottle cap closed and package moved to area with proper ventilation.

item.title: Report X-2023111005

Report X-2023111005

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED INSIDE CONTAINER LID CAME UNSCREWED, PACKAGE SPILLED CONTENTS ONTO SLIDE. RESPONDER SWEPT UP COMPONENTS INTO SPILL TRAY AND TRANSPORTED TO PSC FOR DMP PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2023110574
item.description:
Report X-2023110574

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat came out of the trailer damaged, where QA was notified about the damaged the hazmat. Where it was retrieved then processed DescribePack: There is a big hole on the top of the box from the inner contents exposing the box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: to stand the box upright to avoid the contents to leak out of the loose caps

item.title: Report X-2023110578
item.description:
Report X-2023110578

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-28
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The bottle top must have been loosened during transportation causing the bottle to leak after being unloaded. Once it was discovered, the package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote and brought to QA DescribePack: One bottle top came loose and leaked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottle top was tightened down.
